physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood Pressure: 148/76 mm Hg; Other Vital Signs: Normal.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient appeared well; normal social behavior, articulate speech, and fully oriented. Recalled 2 items out of 5; after cues recalled 4 items. Tone in limbs slightly above normal, more on right than left; all reflexes brisk; plantar responses flexor; remainder of neurologic examination normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During the next 3 months, intermittent tremulousness of left hand developed; fatigue and mental endurance gradually improved.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On examination, patient was fully oriented, recalled one out of three items presented 5 minutes earlier; unable to spell 'world' backward; exhibited perseveration. Remainder of examination was normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased confusion developed, and patient awakened with a black spot in superior visual field of the left eye, which resolved spontaneously after 12 hours.
